Package dataStorage

Class allAppointments

java.lang.Object
dataStorage.allAppointments
public class allAppointments extends Object
This class handles, stores, and manipulates data for all Appointment objects used through out the program.
Author:
Arun Rai

  • Field Details

    • allAppointments

      private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> allAppointments

  • Constructor Details

    • allAppointments

      public allAppointments()

  • Method Details

    • addAppointment

      public static void addAppointment(Appointment newAppointment)
      Method is called when program is iterating through each row during a query to the SQL database. Each iteration calls this method and adds the appointment to the allAppointment Observable List.
      Parameters:
      newAppointment - Appointment to be added to "allAppointments".

    • getAppointments

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getAppointments()
      Returns:
      allAppointments Observable List

    • clearAllAppointments

      public static void clearAllAppointments()
      When data is updated or program needs to refresh data, this method is called and removes all data from allAppointments list, preparing it for a new query.

    • checkIfCustomerHasAppointments

      public static List<Integer> checkIfCustomerHasAppointments(int customer_id)
      Can not delete a Customer that still has Appointments open, this method validates that. Method is called when user selects a customer from home page and clicks "Delete Customer". Passes the Customer ID of the Customer selected, to this method where the program iterates through each appointment in the database. If any of the appointments have the Customer ID as the one passed in, than it adds the Appointment ID of that Appointment to a List.
      Parameters:
      customer_id - Customer we are checking to see if has Appointments.
      Returns:
      a list Appointment IDs that belong to the Customer ID passed in (can be null).

    • getPrimaryKey

      public static int getPrimaryKey()
      Iterates through all Appointments, stores the highest # primary key. After done iterating through list it adds 1 to the highest stored primary key, giving a unique primary key.
      Returns:
      The primary key for new Appointment being added in the "Add Appointment" page.

    • checkIfNotWithinAnotherAppointment2

      public static Appointment checkIfNotWithinAnotherAppointment2(Timestamp startTime, Timestamp endTime, int customer_id, int appointmentId)
      Method is called after a user clicks save on the "Add/Modify Appointment" page, Verifies that the appointment times the user inputted are not currently at the same time as another Appointment that Customer has scheduled. Iterates through each appointment, then finds appointments that match the Customer ID passed in. It compares the start and end time of those Appointments with the start and end time that were passed in.
      Parameters:
      startTime - Start Time of Appointment that is being evaluated.
      endTime - End Time of Appointment that is being evaluated.
      customer_id - Customer we are checking to see if has any Appointments during "startTime" and "endTime".
      appointmentId - Appointment that is being added or modified.
      Returns:
      null if no overlapping Appointments, else it will return the appointment that is overlapping with start and end time passed in.

    • getContactAppointments

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getContactAppointments(String contactName)
      Method is called from "Reports page" when user wants to view appointment for a certain Contact. Contact Name is passed in then program iterates through all Appointments finding the Appointments that have the same Contact Name and adds them to an Observable List.
      Parameters:
      contactName - Contact that we are finding Appointments for.
      Returns:
      Observable List of Appointments that belong to the Contact Name passed in.

    • getCustomerAppointments

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getCustomerAppointments(String customerName)
      Method is called from "Reports page" when user wants to view appointments for a certain Customer. Customer Name is passed in then program iterates through all Appointments finding the Appointments that have the same Customer Name and adds them to an Observable List.
      Parameters:
      customerName - Customer that we are finding Appointments for.
      Returns:
      Observable List of Appointments that belong to the Customer Name passed in.

    • getTypes

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> getTypes()
      This method is called from the "Reports page". Used to populate the ComboBox so the user can select what type of Appointments they want to view. Iterates through each Appointment, and for each Appointment type the program checks if it already has that type in the list. If it does then it won't add it to prevent duplicates. Else it will add it to the list.
      Returns:
      A list of all types of Appointments.

    • getTypeMonthAppointments

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getTypeMonthAppointments(String type, String month)
      This method is called from the "Reports page". User will select what type of Appointments they want to view and for what month. It will display all the matching Appointments and include the number of Appointments that met the parameters the user entered. Also accepts "null" values so if the user just wants to view the type but for a specific month and vice versa that will work as well.
      Parameters:
      type - Type of Appointment that program is finding appointments for.
      month - Month that program is finding appointments for.
      Returns:
      An Observable List of Appointments that match the type and month user entered.

    • getDurationAppointments

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getDurationAppointments(String duration, String type)
      This method is called from the "Appointment By Week" and "Appointment by Month" page. It Accepts the duration that signals which page it was called from, so "week" or "month". Then Accepts the type which signals for if you want to view past, present, or future for your duration. Then collects the Timestamp of the current UTC time, and uses that Timestamp to find the rest of the variables required to evaluate the conditional statement. Such as, Start of next week, Start of this week, etc. Then iterates through all Appointments and adds all Appointments that fall within desired duration and type.
      Parameters:
      duration - Duration that program is finding appointments form, Examples "week" or "month".
      type - Type that program is finding appointments for, Examples "Current", "Previous", "Upcoming".
      Returns:
      Observable List of Appointments that are within the duration and type passed in the method.

    • checkWithin15Minutes

      public static Appointment checkWithin15Minutes()
      This method is ran every time a user successfully logs in. Used to notify user if their are any upcoming Appointments. First collects the current UTC time, then iterates through all Appointments looking for Appointments that are within 15 minutes of that current UTC time.
      Returns:
      Observable List of Appointments.
